alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 02 at 11:29AM PDT until April 03 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT MONDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT MONDAY ABOVE 1000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 2500 feet, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches. For the Winter Weather Advisory above 1000 feet, with snow above 1500 feet through this evening then above 1000 feet through 11 AM PDT Monday morning. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 5 inches. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Coast and Central Douglas County. The Winter Weather Advisory includes Azalea, Glendale, Tiller and Camas Valley. The Winter Storm Warning includes the mountains above 2500 feet. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels around 2000 feet today will fall to around 700 feet late tonight into Monday morning. Light snow of less than an inch is expected below 1000 feet. Additional snow of up to 3 inches is likely above 1000 feet on Tuesday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is occurring and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: Central Douglas County; South Central Oregon Coast
